Characteristics:
Recent Tista, Brahmaputra and
Jamuna alluvium. Mainly unstable
char land.
Places of occurrence (Upazila or parts t:
Tangail: Tangail Sadar, Nagarpur, Kalihati,
Jamalpur: Gopalpur, Sarishabari, Madargonj,
Melandah, Islampur and Dewangonj.
Gaibandah: Gaibandah Sadar and Phulchari.
Kurigram: Kurigram Sadar, Raumari,
Nageswari, Bhurungamari, Ulipur, Chilmari.
Bogura: Saria Kandi and Dhunot.
Pabna: Bera.
Sirajganj: Sirajgonj Sadar, Kazipur,
Kamarkhonda, Belkuchi, Chauhali,
Shahzadpur.

Characteristics:
Recent Ganges and lower Meghna
alluvium. Part unstable char land.
Part saline in the Meghna estuary.
Places of occurrence (Upazila or parts t:
Faridpur: Char Bhadrasan and Sadarpur.
Noakhali: Sudharam, Hatiya.
Lakshmipur: Ramgati.
Feni: Sonagazi.
Chattogram: Sandwip

Characteristics:
Sundarbans (mangrove swamp)
soils with extremely high acidity
(potential or actual) tidally flooded
with blackish or saline water for part
or all the year.

Permanently wet basin peat and
muck, part with alluvial topsoil.
Places of occurrence (Upazila or parts t:
Gopalganj: Gopalganj Sadar, Kasiani,
Kotalipara, Mukusudpur
Madaripur: Madaripur Sadar, Rajoir.
Khulna: Daulatpur, Fultala, Terokheda,
Dumuria
Bagerhat: Mollahat.
Barisal: Bakerganj.
Pirojpur: Nazirpur.
Jashore: Abhoynagar.
Magura: Salika.
Narail: Kalia.

Characteristics:
Grey, finely mottled brown,
seasonally flooded soils with
seasonally acid top-soil and near
neutral subsoils.
Places of occurrence (Upazila or parts t:
Dhaka: Keraniganj, Dhamrai.
Narayangonj: Narayangonj Sadar, Futullah.
Narsingdi: Raipura.
Munshiganj: Munshiganj Sadar, Gazaria.
Gazipur: Kaliganj
Manikganj: Manikganj Sadar, Saturia, Singair,
Daulatpur, Gheor,
Chapainawabganj: Chapainawabganj Sadar,
Jamalpur: Sarishabari, Madargonj.
Tangail: Tangail Sadar, Kalihati, Nagarpur.
Cumilla: Homna.
Chandpur: Chandpur Sadar, Matlabbazar.
Brahmanbaria: Bancharampur.

Soil type unit:
Grey Floodplain Soils
and Non-Calcareous
brown floodplain soils.
Characteristics:
Seasonally wet or shallowly flooded
Grey Floodplain soils on lower
ridges and in depressions with
moderately well-drained, rather acid,
brown loams on higher ridges.
Places of occurrence (Upazila or parts t:
Mymensingh: Kotwali, Ishwargonj, Gouripur.
Jamalpur: Jamalpur Sadar, Islampur.
Dinajpur: Chirirbandar, Fulbari and
Khansama.
Rangpur: Gangachara, Mithapukur,
Badarganj,
Nilphamari: Nilphamari Sadar, Saidpur, Dimla.
Domar, Jhaldaka, Kishoregonj,
Lalmonirhat: Kaliganj, Hatibanda, Patgram,
Gaibandha: Palasbari, Sundargonj.
Bogura: Sherpur.

Soil type unit:
Mixed grey, Dark grey
and Brown Floodplain
soils.
Characteristics:
Tista floodplain soils, Noncalcareous
brown floodplain soils on higher
ridges; seasonally wet or flooded
mainly silty, mixed Grey Floodplain
soils and Non-Calcareous Dark Grey
Floodplain soils on lower ridges and
in depressions.
Places of occurrence (Upazila or parts t:
Lalmonirhat: Lalmonirhat Sadar.
Dinajpur: Fulbari.
Kurigram: Bhurungamari.

Soil type unit:
Grey Floodplain soils
and Non-calcareous
Dark grey floodplain
soils.
Characteristics:
Seasonally wet or shallowly flooded
Grey Floodplain soils, mainly on
ridges, and seasonally shallowly or
deeply flooded Non-calcareous Dark
Grey Floodplain Soils, mainly in
basis.
Places of occurrence (Upazila or parts t:
Narsingdi: Narsingdi.
Narayanganj: Arai hazar.
Munshiganj: Gazaria.
Kishoreganj: Hossainpur.
Netrokona: Mohanganj, Barhatta, Purbadhala.
Mymensingh: Nandail, Phulpur.
Jamalpur: Jamalpur Sadar, Melandah.
Sherpur: Sherpur Sadar, Nakla.
Noakhali: Companyganj, Begumganj, Senbag.
Lakshmipur: Lakshmipur Sadar, Raipur.
Feni: Feni.
Cumilla: Muradnagar, Burichang,
Chauddagram, Laksam, Barura.
Chandpur: Faridganj, Hajigonj.
Brahmanbaria: Nabinagar

Soil type unit:
Grey Floodplain Soils
and Acid basin clays.
Characteristics:
This occupies the eastern Surma-
Kusiyara Floodplain in Sylhet and
the Cumilla basin.
Places of occurrence (Upazila or parts t:
Kishoreganj: Bhairab,
Cumilla: Kotwali and Burichang.
Sylhet: Balaganj, Biswanath; Fenchuganj,
Zakiganj,Beanibazar,
Sunamgonj: Chhatak, Jagannathpur,
Moulvibazar: Rajanagar.

Characteristics:
Grey mottled red or brown, strongly
acid, loams to clays on seasonally
wet or flooded piedmont plains
adjoining the eastern hills.
Places of occurrence (Upazila or parts t:
Chattogram: Kotwali, Doublemoorings,
Mirsarai, Sitakunda, Fatikchari, Raojan,
Rangunia, Boalkhali, Patiya,Satkania,
Cox’s Bazar: Chakaria, Kutubdia and Ramu.
Chattogram Hill Tracts: Lama.
Feni: Chhagalnaiya.
Cumilla: Kasba and Chauddagram.
Maulvibazar: Chunarughat, Kulaura,
Kamalgonj and Barlekha.

Characteristics:
Strongly acid heavy clays, part
permanently wet.
Places of occurrence (Upazila or parts t:
Dhaka: Dohar and Serajdikhan.
Kishoregonj: Astagram, Nikli, Itna,
Netrokona: Kalmakanda and Durgapur.
Madan, Khaliajuri.
Cumilla: Nasirnagar.
Hobigonj: Nabiganj, Lakhai, Azmiriganj,
Sunamganj: Tahirpur, Derai, Sulla and
Jamalganj.
Naogaon: Atrai, Raninagar
Sirajgonj: Tarash.

Characteristics:
Dark grey, finely mottled brown, and
brown soils with dark grey flood
coatings, with seasonally acid top
soils and near-neutral sub-soils.
Mainly seasonally deeply flooded
soils of the old Brahmaputra-
Karatoya-Bangali (Part) and old
Meghna estuarine floodplains.
Places of occurrence (Upazila or parts t:
Dhaka: Tejgaon,
Narayngonj: Araihazar, Rupaganj and
Sonargaon.
Munshigonj:Lohajong, Tongibari.
Kishoregonj: Pakundia, Karimgonj, Tarail,
Bajitpur, Kuliarchar, Kathiadi, Kotoali
Netrakona: Atpara and Kendua.
Mymensingh: Muktagacha, Fulbaria, Trisal,
Jamalpur: Sarisabari,
Tangail: Basail, Ghatail and Kalihati.
Shariatpur: Bhedarganj, Naria, Palong.
Madaripur: Madaripur Sadar.
Noakhali: Ramganj.
Cumilla: Chandina, Debidwar, Daudkandi.
Chandpur: Kachua.
Brahmanbaria: Sarail, Nasirnagar, Nabinagar
and Bancharampur.

Soil type unit:
Calcareous dark grey
floodplain soils and
calcareous brown
floodplain soils.
Characteristics:
Mainly dark grey or brown clays with
dark grey flood coatings, some
calcareous throughout some with
seasonally acid top soils and
calcareous substratum within 4 feet.
Brown calcareous loamy soils on
highest ridges and near river-banks.
Places of occurrence (Upazila or parts t:
Manikganj: Srinagar, Harirampur and
Shivalaya.
Mymensingh: Kotwali.
Faridpur: Bhanga, Nagarkanda,
Gopalganj: Muksudpur, Kotalipara, Kasiani,
Madaripur:Kalkini,
Sharitpur: Baliakandi, Goshairhat, Janjira
and Shibchar.
Rajshahi: Boalia, Paba, Puthia, Charghat.
Chapinababgonj: Bholahat, Shibganj,
Gamustapur.
Natore: Bagatipara, Lalpur, Baraigram and
Gurudaspur.
Pabna: Kotwali, Atgharia, Ishurdi, Chatmohar,
Faridpur, Santhia, Bera and Sujanagar.

Soil type unit:
Calcareous dark grey
floodplain soils with lime
kankar.
Characteristics:
Mainly leached calcareous dark grey
floodplain soils about half with a
hard line kankar layer 2-6 feet deep.

Soil type unit:
Non-calcareous brown
floodplain soils and grey
floodplain soils.
Characteristics:
Brown soils are the dominant soils in
the landscape and the grey soils are
subordinate.
Places of occurrence (Upazila or parts t:
Mymensingh: Phulpur,
Jamalpur: Madargonj, Dewanganj.
Dinajpur: Birganj, Kaharole, Birol, Bochaganj,
Thakurgaon: Baliadangi, Ranisankail,
Haripur, Pirganj.
Panchagarh:Debiganj and Boda.

Characteristics:
Seasonally wet, dark coloured rather
acid, loamy soils on ridges, level
areas and in depressions.

Brown, very strongly acid, mainly
loamy soils.
Places of occurrence (Upazila or parts t:
Mymensingh: Haluaghat.
Sherpur: Sribordi and Nalitabari.
Chattogram: Panchlaish, Hathazari, Mirsarai,
Fatikchari, Rangunia, Anowara, Banskhali,
Cox’s Bazar, Ramu, Moheshkahli, Teknaf and
Ukhiya, all thanas of Chattogram Hill Tracts.
Feni: Chagalnaiya and Parsuram.
Cumilla: Kotwali and Chauddagram.
Sylhet: Kotwali, Gowainghat, Golapgonj,
Jaintapur and Kanaighat.

Characteristics:
Well to moderately well-drained, red
and brown, strongly acid, clay loams
and clays, part over compact
Modhupur clay at 1-3 feet, pert over
deeply mottled clay substratum.
Places of occurrence (Upazila or parts t:
Gazipur: Sripur, Kapasia, Kaligonj, Gazipur
Sadar, Kaliakhair.
Narayngonj: Rupgonj.
Dhaka: Savar.
Narsingdi: Monohardi. Shibpur.
Mymensingh: Fulbaria, Trisal.
Tangail: Ghatail.
Brahmanbaria: Kasba.
Rajshahi: Nowabgonj.
Chapinawabgonj: Chapinawabgonj Sadar
Dinajpur: Gharaghat.
Rangpur: Pirganj.
Gaibandha: Gobindaganj and Sadullapur.

Characteristics:
Poorly drained, grey, mottled, acid
silty soils over a grey, mottled clay
substratum.
Places of occurrence (Upazila or parts t:

Kishoreganj: Durgapur.
